(45) 46.22nd June, 1945.CABINET.COMMITTEE ON DEFENCE RESEARCH.Note by the Secretary of the Cabinet.1. The Prime Minister and Minister of Defence has decided that aCommittee should be set up consisting of : The Paymaster-General (in the Chair).The Chiefs of Staff or their deputies.The Permanent Secretaries of the three Service Departments and of the ministries of Supply and Aircraft Production.The Secretary of the Department of Scientific and Industrial Research.The Director-General of Research and Development in the Ministry ofSupply; andThe Directors of Scientific Research in the Admiralty and Ministry of aircraft Production.The Controller of Research and Development at the Ministry of aircraft production.The Assistant Controller for Research and Development of the Navy.Director of Naval Operational Research, Admiralty.The Scientific Adviser to the Army Council.The Scientific Adviser of the Air Council; andA representative of the Treasury.2. The first task of this Committee will be to prepare a statement of theexisting organisations and institutions engaged on defence research, with some indications of the scope of their work and a statement of the post-war programmes of the Departments. During the war the Defence research institutes and organisations have greatly expanded and there is need for preparation in concert with the Dominions as desirable, of a co-ordinated plan for defence research organisation after the war, in the light of the general research programme.3. It is contemplated that at a later stage, when the main lines of defence organisation have been determined, the Committee may be charged with reviewingfrom time to time the general programmes of all three Services and theirassociated Supply Departments on defence research, with a view to enablingdecisions to be reached as to the broad purposes to which such research should,be devoted, and to enable the necessary priorities to be laid down.4. The Committee will submit their reports, embodying the views of theChiefs of Staff, to the Prime Minister and Minister of Defence, who will consider them in consultation with his Service colleagues, the Supply Ministers and theChancellor of the Exchequer.5. It is contemplated that the Committee will arrange for work on particularsubjects to be carried out through smaller bodies with a more specialisedrepresentation. For this purpose use will be made wherever possible of existingtechnical committees.6. The Joint Secretaries of the Committee will be : Mr. M. T. Flett: Office of the Lord President of the Council.Mr. B. Monck : Ministry of Production.(Signed) E. E. BRIDGES.Cabinet Office, S.W. 1,22nd June, 1945.[30106]
